author: Aryan Mudgal
content: The Resident Deputy Collector has issued directives to shut down all the bars and permit rooms in the district by 12.30 am in view of increasing incidents of chaos and altercations in the district. The new directives were mandated after the city saw a surge in arguments and clashes at bars, permit rooms, and restaurants after midnight.
title: Pune: All Bars, Restaurants To Be Shut Down By 12:30 AM | Know Why

author: Aryan Mudgal
content: The Congress party announced its first list of 39 candidates on Friday ahead of the upcoming Lok Sabha Elections. The party’s list included several key candidates including Rahul Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor, former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel, KC Venugopal and DK Suresh. Of the total candidates, 16 are from Kerala, seven from Karnataka, six from Chhattisgarh and four from Telangana.
title: Lok Sabha Polls: A look at key candidates in Congress' 1st list

author: Disha Jana
content: India has deported the first batch of Myanmar nationals who entered the country illegally to flee surge in fighting between the junta and rebels there. Manipur CM N Biren Singh also posted a video showing the deportation. "Although India isn't a signatory to the 1951 Refugee Convention, it has given shelter...to those fleeing the crisis in Myanmar," he wrote.
title: India deports 1st batch of Myanmar nationals who entered illegally

author: Jayanta Deka
content: Seven Myanmar nationals who entered Manipur illegally were on March 8 deported with officials saying that it was the first batch of 78 foreigners to be deported in the next four days. An official source said that the Myanmar nationals were taken up to Moreh by a chopper from where they would be handed over to the Myanmar authorities.
title: Manipur begins deportation of Myanmar nationals

author: Satarupa Dhar
content: EAM S Jaishankar met with former Japanese Prime Minister Yoshihide Suga, who currently serves as the chairman of the Japan-India Association. Jaishankar expressed his pleasure at the meeting and commended Suga’s impactful leadership in advancing the bilateral relationship between India and Japan. EAM Jaishankar further appreciated his friendship and support for their partnership.
title: Jaishankar commends former Japanese PM Suga’s leadership

author: Medhaa Gupta
content: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan said on Friday that he received the mortal remains of Indian national Pat Nibin Maxwell, who was killed in a missile strike in Israel, at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram airport. He added that he paid his respect. "I share the deep sorrow and anguish experienced by his family members," he further said.
title: Mortal remains of Indian killed in Israel received by MoS Muraleedharan in Kerala

author: Disha Jana
content: Moldova is reportedly planning to arrest Evghenia Gutul, a pro-Russia Governor from Moldova's autonomous region of Gagauzia, following her return from Russia. Gutul, who recently met Russian President Vladimir Putin, sought his support for region's rights. Notably, Moldova's breakaway region of Transnistria, which borders Ukraine to the east, also recently appealed to Russia, seeking protection.
title: Moldova to arrest pro-Russia Governor after her meeting with Putin

author: Satarupa Dhar
content: Former Maldivian President Mohamed Nasheed has voiced significant concerns regarding the ramifications of India’s boycott call on the Maldives, particularly in the context of tourism. Nasheed, currently in India, conveyed apologies on behalf of the Maldivian people. He emphasised their wish for Indian tourists to continue visiting the country.
title: Ex Maldivian President says people of Maldives are sorry

author: Farida
content: Zomato introduces new dress code for female delivery staff on International Women's Day. Female drivers now have the option to wear kurtas, addressing discomfort with standard t-shirts. The move has garnered positive feedback, with many praising the company's progressive initiative. However, some commenters emphasize the need for fair wages and better working conditions for all delivery partners.
title: Zomato Unveils Dress Code for Female Delivery Staff on Women's Day

author: Shreyasi Banerjee
content: While presenting the National Creators Awards, PM Narendra Modi revealed that he used to "pretend to be a palm reader" while travelling in crowded unreserved train compartments during his childhood. "Whenever I saw an opportunity, I would start reading people's palms. Someone would always arrange for a seat for me after this," he added while laughing.
title: I pretended to be a palm reader in crowded trains, always got a seat: PM Modi
